benefits.title: Vitamin D for health: a global perspective.
benefits.summary: Vitamin D deficiency affects musculoskeletal health and has wide-ranging health benefits throughout life, including improving musculoskeletal health and reducing the risk of chronic illnesses.

benefits.title: Sports Health Benefits of Vitamin D
benefits.summary: Vitamin D sufficiency is associated with optimal muscle function, reduced inflammation, pain, and myopathy, and increased muscle protein synthesis, strength, and physical performance.

benefits.title: Vitamin D status: measurement, interpretation, and clinical application.
benefits.summary: Vitamin D promotes bone health, reduces the risk of chronic diseases, and helps maintain healthy blood levels, with a goal of maintaining >30 ng/mL for both children and adults.

benefits.title: Vitamin D insufficiency.
benefits.summary: Vitamin D supplementation reduces the risk of fractures and falls in adults.

benefits.title: Vitamin D and autoimmunity: new aetiological and therapeutic considerations
benefits.summary: Vitamin D supplementation may be therapeutically beneficial, particularly for Th1-mediated autoimmune disorders, and may even be preventive in disorders like multiple sclerosis and diabetes type 1.

benefits.title: A review of the critical role of vitamin D in the functioning of the immune system and the clinical implications of vitamin D deficiency.
benefits.summary: Vitamin D improves barrier function, production of antimicrobial peptides, and immune modulation, potentially benefiting conditions like tuberculosis, psoriasis, eczema, and Crohn's disease.

benefits.title: Immunologic Effects of Vitamin D on Human Health and Disease
benefits.summary: Vitamin D regulates calcium and phosphate metabolism, maintains a healthy mineralized skeleton, and exerts immunologic activities on multiple components of the innate and adaptive immune system.

benefits.title: Vitamin D modulation of innate immune responses to respiratory viral infections
benefits.summary: Vitamin D may be important in protection against respiratory infections, potentially benefiting patients with respiratory disease.

benefits.title: The Role of Vitamin D in Inflammatory Bowel Disease: Mechanism to Management
benefits.summary: Vitamin D has potent anti-inflammatory effects and may help prevent the onset of inflammatory bowel disease and ameliorate disease severity.

benefits.title: Vitamin D in Pain Management
benefits.summary: Vitamin D may reduce pain among patients with vitamin D deficiency, potentially benefiting those with low levels.

side effects.title: Vitamin D physiology.
side effects.summary: Vitamin D deficiency can cause rickets, osteomalacia, bone resorption, osteoporosis, and fractures, and supplementation may decrease fracture incidence.
side effects.journal: Progress in biophysics and molecular biology

side effects.title: The future of vitamin D analogs
side effects.summary: Supraphysiological doses of 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 can lead to calcemic side effects such as hypercalcemia and hypercalciuria.

side effects.title: New vitamin D analogs and changing therapeutic paradigms.
side effects.summary: Side effects of vitamin D compounds include increased levels of serum calcium and phosphate and potential complications.

side effects.title: Vitamin D in hematological disorders and malignancies
side effects.summary: Vitamin D supplementation may induce hypercalcemia in humans, but analogs and combinatorial treatments have been developed to circumvent this side effect.

side effects.title: Assessment of the Effects of Dietary Vitamin D Levels on Olanzapine-Induced Metabolic Side Effects: Focus on the Endocannabinoidome-Gut Microbiome Axis
side effects.summary: Vitamin D deficiency is associated with poor mental health and dysmetabolism.

side effects.title: Vitamin D: is it important in haematopoietic stem cell transplantation? A review
side effects.summary: Vitamin D deficiency is associated with increased complications, including graft-versus-host disease (GvHD), in the HSCT setting.

side effects.title: Prevalence of vitamin D deficiency in Indian women
side effects.summary: Vitamin D deficiency can lead to osteomalacia, osteoporosis, muscle weakness, and increased risk of infections, hypertension, diabetes, obesity, and cardiovascular mortality.
side effects.journal: International journal of reproduction, contraception, obstetrics and gynecology

side effects.title: EB 1089, a novel vitamin D analog with strong antiproliferative and differentiation-inducing effects on target cells.
side effects.summary: EB 1089, a vitamin D analog, displays weaker calcemic side-effects and is more potent in inhibiting proliferation, stimulating differentiation, and inducing apoptosis in various cell types, including cancer cells.

side effects.title: Side-effects of supplementation of vitamin D in a patient with sarcoidosis – a case study
side effects.summary: In rare cases, oversupply of vitamin D can lead to side-effects like hypercalcaemia, which can cause acute kidney injury in patients with sarcoidosis.

side effects.title: Vitamin D Intoxication and Nephrocalcinosis in a Young Breastfed Infant
side effects.summary: Vitamin D intoxication can lead to hypercalcemia, which can cause severe renal complications.

dosage.title: Efficacy and safety of vitamin D3 intake exceeding the lowest observed adverse effect level.
dosage.summary: The 100-microg/d dosage of vitamin D3 effectively increased 25(OH)D to high-normal concentrations in practically all adults and remained within the physiologic range.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Dose Response to Vitamin D Supplementation in Postmenopausal Women
dosage.summary: The recommended daily intake (RDA) of vitamin D(3) for postmenopausal white women with vitamin D insufficiency is 800 IU/d.

dosage.title: A systematic review and meta-analysis of the response of serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D concentration to vitamin D supplementation from RCTs from around the globe
dosage.summary: To reach sufficient 25(OH)D concentration (75 nmol/L), recommended vitamin D supplemental intakes are 1340 and 2250 IU/day for children and pregnant women, 2519 and 797 IU/day for European adults aged 18-64 and 65-85 years, and 729, 2026, and

dosage.title: Estimation of optimal serum concentrations of 25-hydroxyvitamin D for multiple health outcomes.
dosage.summary: Optimal serum concentrations of 25-hydroxyvitamin D for bone health in younger adults and all studied outcomes in older adults should be at least 75 nmol/L.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Vitamin D and its Major Metabolites: Serum Levels after Graded Oral Dosing in Healthy Men
dosage.summary: An 8-week course of vitamin D3 at 10 mg/day (400 IU/day) would raise serum vitamin D by 9 nmol/l and serum 25(OH)D by 11 nmol/l.

dosage.title: Comparative analysis of nutritional guidelines for vitamin D
dosage.summary: Infants should receive 400 international units (IU) daily during their first year of life, and elderly individuals should have access to vitamin D supplementation at dosages varying from 400 IU to 800 IU daily.

dosage.title: Treatment of hypoparathyroidism and pseudohypoparathyroidism with metabolites of vitamin D: evidence for impaired conversion of 25-hydroxyvitamin D to 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin D.
dosage.summary: Minuscule doses of 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 (0.04 to 0.08 mug per kilogram of body weight per day) quickly corrected hypocalcemia and increased intestinal calcium absorption in children with hypoparathyroidism and pseudohypoparathyroidism.
dosage.journal: The New England journal of medicine

dosage.title: Plausible ergogenic effects of vitamin D on athletic performance and recovery
dosage.summary: Vitamin D levels above the normal reference range (up to 100 nmol/L) might increase skeletal muscle function, decrease recovery time, and enhance athletic performance.
dosage.journal: Journal of the International Society of Sports Nutrition

dosage.title: Time out: should vitamin D dosing be based on patient's body mass index (BMI): a prospective controlled study
dosage.summary: Obese patients need higher dosages of vitamin D than the recommended dose, and the dosage should be based on BMI to maintain normal levels for a healthy musculoskeletal system.

dosage.title: Effect of various doses of vitamin D supplementation on pregnant women with gestational diabetes mellitus: A randomized controlled trial.
dosage.summary: High-dose vitamin D supplementation (50,000 IU every 2 weeks) significantly improved insulin resistance in pregnant women with gestational diabetes mellitus.
